channel.title: CyberNetSec - Industrial Control Systems
channel.description: Latest industrial control systems threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Nation-State Actor 'SteelHydra' (APT47) Deploys 'GeoShifter' ICS Malware to Spy on Geothermal Energy Firms
item.description:
The nation-state threat actor 'SteelHydra' (also tracked as APT47) is behind a sophisticated cyber-espionage campaign targeting the geothermal energy sector. According to research from Mandiant, the campaign has impacted firms in the United States, Canada, and Iceland. The attackers are using a nove...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Volt Typhoon Linked to Breach at U.S. Water Utility, Exfiltrating Operational Documents
item.description:
The Chinese state-sponsored group Volt Typhoon has been attributed to a data breach at the Park County Water District in Colorado. According to a joint advisory from CISA, the FBI, and the NSA, the hackers exploited a known vulnerability in an internet-facing network appliance to gain initial access...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: China-Linked APT 'UAT-8837' Targets North American Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
A new report from Cisco Talos has identified a China-nexus Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group, tracked as UAT-8837, actively targeting critical infrastructure organizations in North America since at least 2025. The group gains initial access by exploiting public-facing vulnerabilities, including...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: Drones Emerge as Urgent Cyber Threat to Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
A report published on January 21, 2026, by the University of Canberra and Cisco warns of the urgent and escalating cyber threat posed by drones to critical infrastructure. The study highlights that as drone technology becomes more advanced, accessible, and affordable, its potential for use in cyber ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: GTMaritime Launches 'GT Identify' to Tackle Maritime Cybersecurity and Compliance
item.description:
Maritime technology firm GTMaritime has launched GT Identify, a new cybersecurity system designed to help ship operators comply with increasingly stringent regulations. Announced on January 20, 2026, the system provides fleet-wide hardware and software asset inventory, vulnerability reporting, and a...

Severity: Informational

item.title: Threat Landscape Converges as Attackers Target ICS and AI Systems
item.description:
New research from Cyble highlights a dangerous convergence of threats, as both hacktivists and financially motivated cybercriminals are increasingly targeting Industrial Control Systems (ICS), Operational Technology (OT), and enterprise AI systems. The report, published January 20, 2026, notes that ...

Severity: High

item.title: Asimily Boosts Cisco ISE Integration with Enhanced Microsegmentation for IoT/OT Devices
item.description:
Asimily, a provider of cyber asset and exposure management, has launched enhanced microsegmentation capabilities, including new support for Security Group Access Control Lists (SGACL) in Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE). This integration allows organizations to translate rich device context—such...

item.title: Spanish Energy Giant Endesa Hit by Massive Data Breach, 20M Records Allegedly For Sale
item.description:
Spain's largest electric utility, Endesa, has confirmed a data breach after detecting unauthorized access to a commercial platform. The company admitted that customer PII, contact details, and bank account IBANs were potentially exposed. The situation is amplified by a threat actor on a cybercrime f...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: CISA Warns of Critical Flaws in Rockwell & YoSmart ICS Equipment
item.description:
CISA has released several Industrial Control Systems (ICS) advisories, warning of significant vulnerabilities in widely deployed equipment from Rockwell Automation and YoSmart. A high-severity SQL injection flaw (CVE-2025-12807) in Rockwell's FactoryTalk platform could allow for database takeover, w...

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Patch Management

item.title: Qilin Ransomware Hits French Infra Giant Bouygues, Claims 80GB Data Theft
item.description:
The prolific Qilin ransomware group has listed French multinational infrastructure firm Bouygues Energies & Services as its latest victim on its dark web leak site. The group claims to have exfiltrated 80 GB of highly sensitive data, comprising 31,000 files. Most alarmingly, the threat actors allege...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Ransomware, Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack
